Key Match Events: Tyler O’Neill hit two home runs for the Boston Red Sox in a 7-5 win against the Chicago White Sox.
Andrew Vaughn hit a two-run homer in the first inning for the White Sox.
Rob Refsnyder hit an RBI grounder and O'Neill put Boston ahead with a two-run homer in the first off Garrett Crocket.
O'Neill hit a home run in the fifth off Enyel De Los Santos, his 27th of the season.
Connor Wong added an RBI double in the first.
Romy González had three hits and stole three bases.
Trevor Story went 1 for 4 with an RBI single in his first game since April 5 after recovering from a shoulder injury.
Kenley Jansen got three straight outs on seven pitches for his 26th save in 30 chances.
Andrew Benintendi hit a three-run homer in the seventh against Chase Shugart.
Post-Match Reflections: The White Sox (32-111) are nine defeats shy of tying the 1962 New York Mets for the most losses since 1900 and are on pace to finish 36-126.
The 1899 Cleveland Spiders hold the loss record at 20-134.
Chicago has lost 14 of its last 15 games and 44 of 49.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Boston (72-70) won its second straight game after a five-game losing streak and trails Minnesota (76-66) for the AL's final wild card berth.
Trevor Story returned from a shoulder injury that required surgery and caused him to miss 133 games.
Connor Wong added an RBI double in the first.
Romy González had three hits and stole three bases.
Kenley Jansen got three straight outs on seven pitches for his 26th save in 30 chances, the 446th of his big league career.
Boston is 4-2 against the White Sox, clinching the season series for the first time since 2019.
MLB NEWS section mentions various other MLB-related news.
